New Records: Victor Wembanyama became the first player in NBA history to record multiple games of 20+ points, 15+ rebounds, 5+ blocks and 5+ 3s
Wembanyama became the youngest player in NBA history to notch 10 career games with 7+ blocks at 20 years and 310 days old
Key Match Events: Cavaliers 105, Nets 100: After trailing by as many as 13 points in the 4th quarter, Evan Mobley and Darius Garland ignited a 16-4 Cavs run to close the game
Jazz 111, Spurs 110: In a game featuring 15 ties and 16 lead changes, Victor Wembanyama and rookie Stephon Castle helped San Antonio rally from nine points down in the 3rd quarter
Clippers 105, Raptors 103: James Harden and the Clips let a 12-point lead slip away in the 4th quarter as Immanuel Quickley splashed a 3 to tie the game at 102 with 39 seconds left
Pre-Game Insights: The matchup between Warriors and Thunder features two of the deepest teams in the NBA, as Golden State (9.3) and OKC (8.7) lead the NBA in bench net rating
The duel between Luka Dončić and Nikola Jokić is highlighted as the key matchup in the Mavericks at Nuggets game
Post-Match Reflections: Garland: “We fought. We fought for 48 minutes … That was a big win.”
Championship Company: The Cavs are just the 12th team in NBA history to start a season 11-0. Of those 11 previous teams, six made the NBA Finals, and three won it all
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers are seeking their 12th win in a row, which would be the longest winning streak in franchise history
The Clippers are on a four-game winning streak, with their last loss coming on October 28
